summary.long: Acts is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The former treatise have I made, O Theophilus, concerning all that Jesus began both to do and teach,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until the day when He was taken up, after He had given commandments through the Holy Spirit to the apostles whom He had chosen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom He presented Himself alive after His passion by many infallible proofs, appearing to them for forty days, and speaking concerning the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being assembled with them, He commanded them, “Do not depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, of which you have heard from Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John baptized with water, but you shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had come together, they asked Him, “Lord, will You at this time restore the kingdom to Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “It is not for you to know the times or the dates, which the Father has fixed by His own authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall receive power when the Holy Spirit comes upon you. And you shall be My witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had spoken these things, while they looked, He was taken up. And a cloud received Him from their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they looked intently toward heaven as He ascended, suddenly two men stood by them in white garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Men of Galilee, why stand looking toward heaven? This same Jesus, who was taken up from you to heaven, will come in like manner as you saw Him go into heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives, which is a Sabbath day’s walk from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had entered, they went up into the upper room, where they were staying: Peter, James, John, and Andrew; Philip and Thomas; Bartholomew and Matthew; James the son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot; and Judas the son of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with His brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Peter stood up among the disciples (the number of people together was about a hundred and twenty), and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brothers, this Scripture had to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit previously spoke by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who became the guide to those who seized Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was numbered with us and took part in this ministry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity. And falling headlong, he burst asunder in the middle and all his organs spilled out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It became known to all the residents of Jerusalem. So this field is called in their dialect Akeldama, that is, Field of Blood.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For it is written in the Book of Psalms,
‘Let his habitation become desolate,
    and let no one live in it,’
and,
‘Let another take his office.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, of these men who have accompanied us while the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beginning from the baptism of John until the very day that He was taken up from us, one of these men must become with us a witness of His resurrection.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they proposed two, Joseph, called Barsabbas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they prayed, “You, Lord, who knows the hearts of all men, show which of these two You have chosen
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to take the place in this ministry and apostleship, from which Judas by transgression fell, to go to his own place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they cast lots, and the lot fell on Matthias. So he was numbered with the eleven apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the day of Pentecost had come, they were all together in one place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly a sound like a mighty rushing wind came from heaven, and it filled the whole house where they were sitting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There appeared to them tongues as of fire, being distributed and resting on each of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other tongues, as the Spirit enabled them to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now dwelling in Jerusalem were Jews, devout men, from every nation under heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When this sound occurred, the crowd came together and were confounded, because each man heard them speaking in his own language.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were all amazed and marveled, saying to each other, “Are not all these who are speaking Galileans?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How is it that we hear, each in our own native language?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Parthians, Medes and Elamites, residents of Mesopotamia, Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the regions of Libya near Cyrene, and visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cretans and Arabs—we hear them speaking in our own languages the mighty works of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were all amazed and perplexed, saying to each other, “What does this mean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others mocking said, “These men are full of new wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice and said to them, “Men of Judea and all you who dwell in Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and listen to my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these are not drunk, as you suppose, since it is the third hour of the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is what was spoken by the prophet Joel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘In the last days it shall be,’ says God,
    ‘that I will pour out My Spirit on all flesh;
your sons and your daughters shall prophesy,
    your young men shall see visions,
    and your old men shall dream dreams.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And I will show wonders in heaven above
    and signs on the earth below:
    blood, and fire, and vapor of smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun shall be turned into darkness,
    and the moon into blood,
    before that great and glorious day of the Lord comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And whoever calls
    on the name of the Lord shall be saved.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus of Nazareth was a man attested to you by God with powerful works and wonders and signs, which God did through Him in your midst, as you yourselves know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have taken Him, who was handed over to you by the ordained counsel and foreknowledge of God, and by lawless hands have crucified and killed Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom God raised up by loosening the pull of death, because it was not possible that He should be held by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For David says concerning Him:
‘I foresaw the Lord always before me,
    for He is at my right hand,
    that I may not be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore my heart was glad, and my tongue rejoiced;
    moreover my flesh will dwell in hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For You will not abandon my soul to Hades,
    nor will You allow Your Holy One to see corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made known to me the ways of life;
    You will make me full of joy with Your presence.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brothers, I may speak confidently to you concerning the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him, that of his seed according to the flesh, He would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he foresaw this and spoke concerning the resurrection of the Christ, that His soul was not abandoned to Hades, nor did His flesh see corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God raised up this Jesus, of which we all are witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore being exalted to the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, He has poured out this which you now see and hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For David has not ascended to the heavens, yet he says:
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
    “Sit at My right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Until I make Your enemies
    Your footstool.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, let all the house of Israel assuredly know that God has made this Jesus, whom you have crucified, both Lord and Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they were stung in the heart and said to Peter and to the rest of the apostles, “Brothers, what shall we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to them, “Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of sins, and you shall receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the promise is to you, and to your children, and to all who are far away, as many as the Lord our God will call.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With many other words he testified and exhorted them, saying, “Be saved from this perverse generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those who gladly received his word were baptized, and that day about three thousand souls were added to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They continued steadfastly in the apostles’ teaching and fellowship, in the breaking of bread and in the prayers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear came to every soul. And many wonders and signs were done through the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who believed were together and had all things in common.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sold their property and goods and distributed them to all, according to their need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And continuing daily with one mind in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, they ate their food with gladness and simplicity of heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily those who were being saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter and John went up together to the temple at the ninth hour, the hour of prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man lame from birth was being carried, whom people placed daily at the gate of the temple called Beautiful to ask alms from those who entered the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, he asked for alms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter, gazing at him with John, said, “Look at us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he paid attention to them, expecting to receive something from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said, “I have no silver and gold, but I give you what I have. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, rise up and walk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took him by the right hand and raised him up. Immediately his feet and ankles were strengthened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jumping up, he stood and walked and entered the temple with them, walking and jumping and praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people saw him walking and praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They knew that it was he who sat for alms at the Beautiful Gate of the temple. And they were filled with wonder and amazement at what happened to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the lame man who was healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the entrance that is called Solomon’s Porch, greatly amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter saw it, he answered the people: “Men of Israel, why do you marvel at this man? Or why do you stare at us, as if by our own power or piety we had made him walk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified His Son Jesus, whom you handed over and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had decided to release Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You denied the Holy and Righteous One and asked for a murderer to be granted to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you killed the Creator of Life, whom God has raised from the dead, of which we are witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And His name, by faith in His name, has made this man strong, whom you see and know. And faith which comes through Him has given him perfect health in your presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now brothers, I know that you acted in ignorance, as did also your rulers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what God foretold through all the prophets, that His Christ should suffer, He thus fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore repent and be converted, that your sins may be wiped away, that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that He may send the One who previously was preached to you, Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom the heavens must receive until the time of restoring what God spoke through all His holy prophets since the world began.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses indeed said to the fathers, ‘The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your brothers. You shall hear whatever He may say to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be that every soul who will not hear that prophet shall be utterly eliminated from the people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Indeed, all the prophets since Samuel and those who follow, as many as have spoken, have likewise foretold these days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are the sons of the prophets and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘And in your seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God, having raised up His Son Jesus, sent Him to you first, to bless you in turning every one of you from your iniquities.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they spoke to the people, the priests, the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees came upon them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: being greatly troubled because they taught the people and preached through Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they seized them and put them in custody until the next day, for it was already evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many of those who heard the word believed, and the number of the men grew to about five thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day their rulers and elders and scribes
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: were assembled at Jerusalem with Annas the high priest, and Caiaphas, and John and Alexander, and all who were of the family of the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had stood them in the midst, they asked, “By what power or by what name have you done this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “Rulers of the people and elders of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we today are being examined concerning a good deed done to a crippled man, how this man has been healed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: be it known to you all, and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead, by Him this man stands before you whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is
‘the stone you builders rejected,
    which has become the cornerstone.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no salvation in any other, for there is no other name under heaven given among men by which we must be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw the boldness of Peter and John and perceived that they were illiterate and uneducated men, they marveled. And they recognized that they had been with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But seeing the man who was healed standing with them, they had nothing to say against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had commanded them to go outside of the Sanhedrin, they conferred among themselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “What shall we do to these men? For, indeed, that an acknowledged miracle has been done through them is revealed to all who dwell in Jerusalem, and we cannot deny it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But lest it spread further among the people, let us threaten them that they no longer speak to anyone in this name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they called them and commanded them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter and John answered them, “Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you more than to God, you judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we cannot help but declare what we have seen and heard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding no way to punish them, because of the people. For all glorified God for what was done,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the man on whom this miracle of healing was performed was over forty years old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On being released, they went to their own people and reported what the chief priests and elders had said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they lifted their voices in unity to God and prayed, “Lord, You are God, who has made the heaven and the earth and the sea and everything in them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and who by the mouth of Your servant David said:
‘Why did the nations rage,
    and the people devise vain things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of the earth came,
    and the rulers were assembled together
against the Lord
    and against His Christ.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel, were assembled together against Your holy Son Jesus whom You have anointed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to do what Your hand and Your counsel had foreordained to be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, Lord, look on their threats and grant that Your servants may speak Your word with great boldness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by stretching out Your hand to heal and that signs and wonders may be performed in the name of Your holy Son Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had prayed, the place where they were assembled together was shaken. And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and spoke the word of God with boldness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the believers were of one heart and one soul, and no one said that what he possessed was his own. But to them all things were in common.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With great power the apostles testified to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus, and great grace was on them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was no one among them who lacked, for all those who were owners of land or houses sold them, and brought the income from what was sold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and placed it at the apostles’ feet. And it was distributed to each according to his need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph, whom the apostles called Barnabas (which means, Son of Encouragement), a Levite from the land of Cyprus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sold a field he owned, and brought the money and placed it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a man named Ananias, with his wife Sapphira, sold a piece of property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He kept back part of the proceeds with his wife’s knowledge, and brought a part of it and placed it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said, “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to deceive the Holy Spirit and keep back part of the proceeds of the land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While it remained unsold, was it not your own? And when it was sold, was it not under your authority? Why have you conceived this deed in your heart? You did not lie to men, but to God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On hearing these words, Ananias fell down and died. And great fear came on all those who heard these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young men rose and wrapped him up and carried him out and buried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About three hours later his wife came in, not knowing what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peter said to her, “Tell me whether you sold the land for this amount?”
She said, “Yes, for that much.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to her, “How is it that you have agreed together to test the Spirit of the Lord? Look! The feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once she fell down at his feet and died. Upon entering, the young men found her dead and carried her out and buried her beside her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Great fear came on the entire church and on all those who heard these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many signs and wonders were performed among the people by the hands of the apostles. And they were all together in Solomon’s Porch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one else dared join them, but the people respected them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Believers were increasingly added to the Lord, crowds of both men and women,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they even brought the sick out into the streets and placed them on beds and mats, that at least the shadow of Peter passing by might touch some of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Crowds also came out of the cities surrounding Jerusalem, bringing the sick and those who were afflicted by evil spirits, and they were all healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest and all those who were with him (that is, the sect of the Sadducees) rose up and were filled with jealousy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They seized the apostles and put them in the common prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors and led them out, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Having heard this, they entered the temple at dawn and taught.
But the high priest and those who were with him came and called together the Sanhedrin and the senate of all the sons of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the officers came and did not find them in the prison, they returned and reported,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We found the prison securely shut and the guards standing outside before the doors. But when we opened it, we found no one inside.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the high priest, the captain of the temple, and the chief priests heard these things, they were in doubt of what might become of this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one came and told them, “Look, the men whom you put in prison are standing in the temple and teaching the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the captain with his escorts went and brought them, without force lest they should be stoned, for they feared the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had brought them, they stood them before the Sanhedrin. And the high priest questioned them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Did we not strictly command you not to teach in this name? Yet now you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and you intend to bring on us this Man’s blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter and the other apostles answered, “We must obey God rather than men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of our fathers raised Jesus, whom you killed by hanging on a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God exalted this Man to His right hand to be a Ruler and a Savior, to give repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are His witnesses to these words, as is the Holy Spirit whom God has given to those who obey Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they were cut to the heart and took counsel to kill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a Pharisee in the Sanhedrin named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law honored by all the people, stood and ordered the apostles to be put outside for a little while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what you intend to do concerning these men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in previous days Theudas rose up, boasting to be somebody, to whom a number of about four hundred men joined themselves. He was killed, and all who obeyed him were dispersed and came to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Theudas, Judas the Galilean rose up in the days of the census and drew away many people after him. This man also perished, and all who obeyed him were scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I tell you, keep away from these men and leave them alone, because if this intention or this activity is of men, it will come to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is of God, you will not be able to overthrow them, lest perhaps you be found even fighting against God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They agreed with him. When they had called in the apostles, they beat them, and commanded them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and released them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they departed from the presence of the Sanhedrin, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Daily, in the temple and from house to house, they did not cease to teach and preach Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in those days, as the disciples were multiplied, there was murmuring among the Hellenists against the Hebrews, because their widows were overlooked in the daily distribution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the twelve called the multitude of disciples together and said, “It is not reasonable for us to leave the word of God and serve tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, look among yourselves for seven men who are known to be full of the Holy Spirit and of wisdom, whom we will appoint over this duty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we will give ourselves continually to prayer and to the ministry of the word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what was said pleased the whole multitude, and they chose Stephen, who was a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, and Philip, and Procorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas, a proselyte from Antioch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom they presented before the apostles. And when they had prayed, they placed their hands on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the word of God spread, and the number of the disciples grew rapidly in Jerusalem, and a great number of the priests were obedient to the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some men rose up from what is called the Synagogue of the Freedmen (Cyrenians, Alexandrians, and those from Cilicia and of Asia), disputing with Stephen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were not able to withstand the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they secretly instigated men who said, “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they stirred up the people and the elders and the scribes, and came upon him and seized him and led him to the Sanhedrin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and set up false witnesses who said, “This man does not cease to speak blasphemous words against this holy place and the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place, and will change the customs which Moses handed down to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who sat in the Sanhedrin, gazing at him, saw his face as the face of an angel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest said, “Are these things so?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Brothers and fathers, listen! The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Harran,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, ‘Leave your country and your relatives, and come to the land which I will show you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then he departed from the land of the Chaldeans and lived in Harran. When his father died, He removed him from there to this land in which you now live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave him no inheritance in it, nor a foothold, and promised to give it to him as a possession and to his descendants after him while he had no child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God spoke in this way, ‘Your descendants shall be sojourners in a land belonging to others, who will enslave them and mistreat them four hundred years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will judge the nation to whom they will be enslaved,’ said God. ‘After that they shall come out and worship Me in this place.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He gave him the covenant of circumcision. And Abraham became the father of Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day. And Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob of the twelve patriarchs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The patriarchs, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt. But God was with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh, king of Egypt, who appointed him governor over Egypt and all his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then a famine came over all Egypt and Canaan with great affliction, and our fathers found no sustenance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers the first time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the second time Joseph was made known to his brothers, and Joseph’s family became known to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph sent and called for his father Jacob and all his kindred, seventy-five souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob went down into Egypt. And he and our fathers died,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and were carried to Shechem and put in the tomb that Abraham had bought for a price of silver from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the time of the promise drew near, which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until another king rose up who did not know Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He dealt deceitfully with our people and mistreated our fathers, forcing them to put out their young children, that they might not live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time Moses was born, and was fair in the sight of God. And he was reared for three months in his father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was put out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him up and reared him as her own son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians and was powerful in words and in deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When he was forty years old, it came to his heart to visit his brothers, the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But seeing one being wronged, he defended him, and avenged him who was oppressed, and struck the Egyptian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He supposed that his brothers would understand that God would deliver them by his hand, but they did not understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day he appeared to them as they fought and tried to reconcile them in peace, saying, ‘Men, you are brothers. Why do you wrong each other?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the one wronging his neighbor pushed him away, saying, ‘Who appointed you a ruler and a judge over us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses fled at this word and became a sojourner in the land of Midian, where he became the father of two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When forty years had passed, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses saw it, he marveled at the sight. As he drew near to look at it, the voice of the Lord came to him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.’ Moses trembled and dared not look.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the Lord said to him, ‘Take off the shoes from your feet, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have indeed seen the oppression of My people who are in Egypt. I have heard their groaning, and I have come down to deliver them. Now come, I will send you to Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This Moses, whom they rejected, saying, ‘Who appointed you a ruler and a judge?’ God sent as both ruler and redeemer by the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He led them out after he had shown wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, and at the Red Sea, and for forty years in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the Moses who said to the sons of Israel, ‘The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your brothers. Him you shall hear.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is he who was in the congregation in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers, who received living oracles to give to us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom our fathers would not obey, but thrust away. And in their hearts they turned back to Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to Aaron, ‘Make for us gods to go before us. For we do not know what has become of this Moses, who led us out of the land of Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they made a calf in those days, and offered a sacrifice to the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God turned and gave them up to worship the host of heaven, as it is written in the book of the Prophets:
‘O House of Israel, have you offered to Me slain animals and sacrifices
    for forty years in the wilderness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, you even raised the shrine of Moloch,
    and the star of your god Remphan,
    idols which you made to worship;
therefore I will exile you beyond Babylon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, telling Moses to make it as He had commanded, according to the pattern that he had seen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which our fathers, having received it, brought with Joshua into the land possessed by the Gentiles, whom God drove out in front of our fathers until the days of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who found favor in the presence of God and asked to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Solomon built Him a house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “However, the Most High does not dwell in houses made with hands. As the prophet says:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Heaven is My throne,
    and the earth is My footstool.
What house will you build for Me? says the Lord,
    or what is the place of My rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has not My hand made all these things?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You stiff-necked people, uncircumcised in heart and ears! You always resist the Holy Spirit. As your fathers did, so do you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of the prophets have your fathers not persecuted? They have even killed those who foretold the coming of the Righteous One, of whom you have now become the betrayers and murderers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who have received the law by the disposition of angels, but have not kept it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed their teeth at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But being full of the Holy Spirit, he gazed into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Look! I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they cried out with a loud voice, closed their ears, and rushed at him in unison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they threw him out of the city and stoned him. The witnesses laid down their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stoned Stephen as he was calling on God, praying, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he knelt down and cried with a loud voice, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them.” Having said this, he fell asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Saul was consenting to his death.
On that day a great persecution broke out against the church in Jerusalem. And they were all scattered throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Devout men carried Stephen to his burial and made great lamentation over him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul ravaged the church, entering house by house and dragging out both men and women and committing them to prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore those who were scattered went everywhere preaching the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip went down to the city of Samaria and preached Christ to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowds heard Philip and saw the miracles which he did, they listened in unity to what he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For unclean spirits, crying with a loud voice, came out of many who were possessed. And many who were paralyzed or lame were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there was much joy in that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a man named Simon was previously in the city practicing sorcery and astonishing the nation of Samaria, saying he was someone great,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom they all listened, from the least to the greatest, saying, “This man is the great power of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They listened to him, because for a long time he had astonished them by his sorceries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they believed Philip preaching about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, both men and women were baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even Simon himself believed. And when he was baptized, he continued with Philip and was amazed as he watched the miracles and signs which were done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came down, they prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for still He had come on none of them. They were only baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Simon saw that through the laying on of the apostles’ hands the Holy Spirit was given, he offered them money,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Give me also this power, that whomever I lay hands on may receive the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “May your money perish with you, because you thought you could purchase the gift of God with money!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have neither part nor share in this matter, for your heart is not right before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore repent of your wickedness, and ask God if perhaps the intention of your heart may be forgiven you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bond of iniquity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon answered, “Pray to the Lord for me that nothing you have spoken may come upon me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had testified and preached the word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now an angel of the Lord said to Philip, “Rise up and go toward the south on the way that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.” This is desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he rose up and went. And there was a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was in command of her entire treasury. He had come to Jerusalem to worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was returning, sitting in his chariot and reading the book of Isaiah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit said to Philip, “Go to this chariot and stay with it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Philip ran to him, and heard him read the book of Isaiah the prophet, and said, “Do you understand what you are reading?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “How can I, unless someone guides me?” So he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The passage of Scripture which he was reading was this:
“He was led as a sheep to slaughter;
    and as a lamb before its shearer is silent,
    so He opened not His mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The eunuch said to Philip, “I ask you, of whom does the prophet speak, of himself or of someone else?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Philip spoke, beginning with the same Scripture, and preached Jesus to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went on their way, they came to some water. And the eunuch said, “Look, here is water. What hinders me from being baptized?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip said, “If you believe with all your heart, you may.” He answered, “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded the chariot to halt. Then both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water, and he baptized him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord took Philip away. And the eunuch saw him no more, and he went his way rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Philip was found at Azotus. And passing through, he preached the gospel in all the cities until he came to Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul, still breathing out threats and murder against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and requested letters from him to the synagogues of Damascus, so that if he found any there of the Way, either men or women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he went he drew near Damascus, and suddenly a light from heaven shone around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul, why do you persecute Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “Who are You, Lord?”
The Lord said, “I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting. It is hard for you to kick against the goads.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Trembling and astonished, he said, “Lord, what will You have me do?” The Lord said to him, “Rise up and go into the city, and you will be told what you must do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men traveling with him stood speechless, hearing the voice, but seeing no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul rose up from the ground. And when his eyes were opened, he saw nothing. So they led him by the hand and brought him into Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For three days he was without sight, and neither ate nor drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A disciple named Ananias was in Damascus. The Lord said to him in a vision, “Ananias.”
He said, “Here I am, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to him, “Rise and go to Straight Street, and inquire at Judas’ house for someone named Saul of Tarsus, for he is praying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and has seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in and putting his hand on him, so that he may see again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ananias answered, “Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how many evil things he has done to Your saints at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call on Your name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to him, “Go your way. For this man is a chosen vessel of Mine, to bear My name before the Gentiles and their kings, and before the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will show him how much he must suffer for My name’s sake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ananias went his way and entered the house. Putting his hands on him, he said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, who appeared to you on the way as you came, has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately something like scales fell from his eyes, and he could see again. And he rose up and was baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he had eaten, he was strengthened.
For several days Saul was with the disciples in Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he preached in the synagogues that the Christ is the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who heard him were amazed and said, “Is not this he who killed those who called on this name in Jerusalem, and came here with that intent, to bring them bound to the chief priests?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet Saul increased all the more with power and confounded the Jews living in Damascus, proving that this One is the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After many days had passed, the Jews arranged to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their scheme was known by Saul. They watched the gates day and night to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the disciples took him by night, and lowered him in a basket through the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Saul had come to Jerusalem, he tried to join the disciples. But they all feared him, not believing he was a disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Barnabas took him, and led him to the apostles, and declared to them how on the road he had seen the Lord, and that He had spoken to him, and how he had boldly preached in Damascus in the name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he stayed with them while coming in and going out of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spoke boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus and disputed against the Hellenists. But they tried to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the brothers learned this, they brought him down to Caesarea, and sent him off to Tarsus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the churches throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria had peace and were built up. And walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, they were multiplied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Peter passed through every region, he came down also to the saints who lived in Lydda.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There he found a man named Aeneas, who had been bedridden for eight years and was paralyzed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus the Christ heals you. Rise up and make your bed.” And immediately he rose up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him and turned to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha, which is translated Dorcas. This woman was full of good works and almsgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days she became ill and died. And when they had washed her, they placed her in an upper room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, hearing that Peter was there, sent two men to him, pleading, “Do not delay to come to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter rose up and went with them. When he arrived, they led him into the upper room. All the widows stood by him weeping, and showing the tunics and garments which Dorcas had made while she was with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter put them all outside and knelt down and prayed. And turning to the body he said, “Tabitha, arise.” She opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter she sat up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave her his hand and lifted her up. And when he had called the saints and widows, he presented her alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He remained in Joppa for many days with Simon, a tanner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, the centurion of a band of soldiers called the Italian Detachment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a devout man and one who feared God with all his household, who gave many alms to the people and continually prayed to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About the ninth hour of the day he saw clearly in a vision an angel of God coming in and saying to him, “Cornelius.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he looked at him he was afraid, and said, “What is it, Lord?”
He said to him, “Your prayers and your alms have come up as a memorial before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now send men to Joppa, and bring back Simon whose surname is Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is lodging with Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the sea. He will tell you what you must do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the angel who spoke to him had departed, Cornelius called two of his household servants and a devout soldier from among those who continually waited on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had explained everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day as they went on their journey and drew near the city, Peter went up on the housetop to pray about the sixth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He became very hungry and desired to eat. But while they prepared a meal, he fell into a trance
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saw heaven opened, and a vessel like a great sheet, tied at the four corners, descending to him, and let down to the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In it were all kinds of four-footed animals of the earth and wild beasts and reptiles and birds of the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a voice came to him, “Rise, Peter; kill and eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said, “Not at all, Lord. For I have never eaten anything that is common or unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The voice spoke to him a second time: “What God has cleansed, do not call common.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened three times. And again the vessel was taken up into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Peter wondered what this vision which he had seen might mean, the men who were sent by Cornelius had inquired for Simon’s house and stood at the gate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and called and asked whether Simon, who was surnamed Peter, was lodging there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter thought about the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Three men are looking for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So rise and go down, and go with them, doubting nothing. For I have sent them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter went down to the men who were sent to him by Cornelius and said, “Here I am, the one you are seeking. Why have you come?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Cornelius, a centurion, a man who is righteous and fears God and is of good report throughout the nation of the Jews, was directed by a holy angel to summon you to his house to hear your words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he invited them in and gave them lodging.
The next day Peter went with them, and some brothers from Joppa accompanied him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next day they entered Caesarea. Cornelius was waiting for them and had called together his relatives and close friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Peter entered the house, Cornelius met him and fell down at his feet and worshipped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter lifted him up, saying, “Stand up. I myself am a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he talked with him, he went in and found many who had come together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You know how unlawful it is for a Jew to visit or approach a foreigner. But God has shown me not to call any man common or unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when I was sent for, I came without question. Therefore I ask why you have sent for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cornelius said, “Four days ago I was fasting until this hour. At the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and suddenly a man stood before me in bright clothing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard, and your alms are remembered before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore send to Joppa for Simon, whose surname is Peter. He is lodging in the house of Simon, a tanner, by the sea. When he comes, he will speak to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So immediately I sent for you, and you have done well to come. Now therefore we are all here, present before God, to hear everything the Lord has commanded you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter began to speak, saying, “Truthfully, I perceive that God is no respecter of persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in every nation he who fears Him and works righteousness is accepted by Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which He sent to the children of Israel, preaching peace through Jesus Christ, who is Lord of all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the word, which you know, that was proclaimed throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee after the baptism which John preached:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power, who went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We are witnesses of all that He did both in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem, whom they killed by hanging on a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God raised Him on the third day and presented Him publicly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not to all the people, but to witnesses previously chosen by God, to us who ate and drank with Him after He rose from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that it is He who was ordained by God to be the Judge of the living and the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Him all the prophets bear witness that whoever believes in Him will receive remission of sins through His name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell on all those who heard the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the believers of the circumcision who had come with Peter were astonished, because the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out even on the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they heard them speaking in other tongues and magnifying God.
Then Peter continued,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Can anyone forbid water for baptizing these, who have received the Holy Spirit as we have?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then they asked him to stay a few days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles and the brothers throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Peter went up to Jerusalem, those who were circumcised disputed with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “You went in and ate with uncircumcised men!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter began explaining it to them in order, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I was in the city of Joppa praying. And in a trance I saw a vision: A vessel like a great sheet was descending, let down from heaven by four corners, and it came to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I considered what I had observed and saw four-footed creatures and wild beasts and reptiles and birds of the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I heard a voice saying to me, ‘Rise, Peter; kill and eat.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I said, ‘Not at all, Lord. For nothing common or unclean has at any time entered my mouth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The voice answered from heaven a second time, ‘What God has cleansed, do not call common.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened three times. And again everything was taken up into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And immediately three men sent from Caesarea to me came to the house where I was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit told me to go with them without hesitation. Moreover these six brothers came with me, and we entered the man’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told us how he had seen an angel in his house, who stood and said to him, ‘Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon whose surname is Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will speak words to you by which you and all your household will be saved.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them, as He fell on us at the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I remembered the word of the Lord, how He said, ‘John indeed baptized with water, but you shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then God gave them the same gift as He gave us when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to be able to hinder God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard these things, they were silent. And they glorified God, saying, “Then God has granted to the Gentiles also repentance unto life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who were scattered by the persecution that arose over Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, preaching the word to no one except Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they had come to Antioch, spoke to the Hellenists, preaching the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number believed and turned to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: News of these things came to the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he arrived and saw the grace of God, he rejoiced and exhorted them all to remain with the Lord with a loyal heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And many people were added to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. For a whole year they met with the church and taught a considerable crowd. And the disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In these days prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, named Agabus, stood up and prophesied by the Spirit that there would be a great famine throughout all the world, which came to pass in the days of Claudius Caesar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then every disciple, according to his ability, determined to send relief to the brothers who lived in Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed they did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About that time King Herod extended his hands to harm certain ones from the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He killed James the brother of John with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to arrest Peter also. This happened during the Days of Unleavened Bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had seized him, he put him in prison and handed him over to four squads of soldiers to guard him, intending to bring him before the people after the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter was kept in prison. But the church prayed to God without ceasing for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The very night when Herod would have brought him out, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains. And the guards before the door were securing the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly an angel of the Lord approached him, and a light shone in the prison. He struck Peter on the side and woke him up, saying, “Rise up, quickly.” And the chains fell off his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel said to him, “Dress yourself and put your sandals on.” And he did so. Then he said to him, “Wrap your cloak around you and follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went out and followed him, and did not know that what was done by the angel was real, but thought he was seeing a vision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had passed the first and the second guards, they came to the iron gate leading to the city, which opened to them by itself. And they went out and went forward one street. And immediately the angel left him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter had come to himself, he said, “Now I certainly know that the Lord has sent His angel and delivered me from the hand of Herod and from all that the Jewish people were expecting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Realizing this, he came to the house of Mary, the mother of John, whose other name was Mark, where many were gathered together praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Peter knocked at the door of the porch, a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she recognized Peter’s voice, from joy she did not open the door, but ran in and announced that Peter was standing at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to her, “You are insane.” But she insisted that it was really so. So they said, “It is his angel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter continued knocking. And when they opened the door and saw him, they were astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Motioning to them with his hand to be quiet, he described to them how the Lord had led him out of the prison. And he said, “Go, tell these things to James and to the brothers.” Then he departed and went to another place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when day came, there was a great disturbance among the soldiers about what had become of Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Herod had searched for him and did not find him, he examined the guards and commanded that they should be put to death.
Then he went down from Judea to Caesarea, and stayed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Herod was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon. But they came to him in unity, and having made Blastus, the king’s personal servant, their friend, they asked for peace, because their country was fed by the king’s country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On an appointed day, Herod, dressed in royal apparel, sat on his throne and gave a public speech to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mob shouted, “It is the voice of a god, and not of a man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him, because he did not give God the glory. And he was eaten by worms and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the word of God spread and increased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Barnabas and Saul had fulfilled their ministry, they returned from Jerusalem and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the church that was in Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they worshipped the Lord and fasted, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for Me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after fasting and praying, they laid their hands on them and sent them off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia, and from there they sailed to Cyprus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they arrived at Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. And they had John as an assistant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had gone through the whole island to Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a Jewish false prophet, whose name was Bar-Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, an intelligent man. This man called for Barnabas and Saul and sought to hear the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Elymas the sorcerer (which is his name by interpretation) opposed them, trying to divert the proconsul from the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Saul, who also is called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, stared at him and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You son of the devil, enemy of all righteousness, full of deceit and of all fraud, will you not cease perverting the right ways of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now, look! The hand of the Lord is against you, and you shall be blind, not seeing the sun for a time.”
Immediately mist and darkness fell on him, and he went about seeking someone to lead him by the hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the proconsul saw what had happened, he believed and was astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Paul and his companions set sail from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia. And John departed from them and returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they departed from Perga and came to Antioch in Pisidia. And they went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day and sat down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the reading from the Law and the Prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent word to them, saying, “Brothers, if you have any word of exhortation for the people, say it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul stood up, and motioning with his hand said: “Men of Israel, and you who fear God, listen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they lived as foreigners in the land of Egypt, and with great power He led them out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For about forty years He endured their conduct in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, He gave them their land as an inheritance by lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After about four hundred and fifty years, God gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they requested a king. And God gave them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had removed him, He raised up David to be their king, of whom He testified, saying, ‘I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after My own heart, who will fulfill My entire will.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “From this man’s descendants God has raised a Savior for Israel, Jesus, according to His promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before His coming John had preached a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As John was fulfilling his course, he said, ‘Who do you think I am? I am not He. But look! He is coming after me, the sandals of whose feet I am not worthy to untie.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brothers, sons of the family of Abraham, and those of you who fear God, the word of this salvation has been sent to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because those who live in Jerusalem, and their rulers, did not know Him, in condemning Him they have fulfilled the voices of the Prophets which are read every Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though they found in Him no cause worthy of death, yet they asked Pilate to have Him killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had fulfilled all that was written of Him, they took Him down from the tree and placed Him in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God raised Him from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for many days He appeared to those who came up with Him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are now His witnesses to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We preach to you good news: The promise which was made to the fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
That He raised Him from the dead, no more to return to corruption, He has spoken in this way:
‘I will give You the holy and sure blessings of David.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So He says in another Psalm:
‘You will not let Your Holy One see decay.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For after David had served by the counsel of God in his own generation, he fell asleep, was buried with his fathers, and saw decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He whom God raised up saw no decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, brothers, let it be known to you that through this Man forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and by Him everyone who believes is justified from everything from which you could not be justified by the Law of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore beware, lest what is spoken of in the prophets come upon you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Look, you scoffers,
    marvel and perish!
For I will perform a work in your days
    which you will never believe,
    even if someone declares it to you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Paul and Barnabas went out of the synagogue, the Gentiles asked that these words might be preached to them the next Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the congregation was dismissed, many of the Jews and devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who spoke to them and urged them to continue in the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next Sabbath almost the whole city assembled to hear the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy, blaspheming and contradicting what Paul was saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul and Barnabas boldly said, “It was necessary that the word of God should be spoken to you first. But seeing you reject it, and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, we are turning to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus has the Lord commanded us:
‘I have established you to be a light of the Gentiles,
    that you may bring salvation to the ends of the earth.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Gentiles heard this, they were glad and glorified the word of the Lord. And all who were ordained to eternal life believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord was spread throughout the entire region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honorable women and the chief men of the city, and raised up persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and drove them from their region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they shook off the dust of their feet against them and went to Iconium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At Iconium they entered the synagogue of the Jews together and so spoke that a great crowd of both Jews and Greeks believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles and embittered their minds against the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they continued there a long time, speaking boldly for the Lord, who bore witness to His gracious word, granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people of the city were divided. Some sided with the Jews, and others with the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When an assault was planned by both Gentiles and Jews, with their leaders, to attack them and to stone them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they learned of it and fled to Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and to the surrounding region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there they preached the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Lystra there sat a man, crippled in his feet, who had never walked and was lame from birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He heard Paul speaking, who looked intently at him and perceived that he had faith to be healed
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said with a loud voice, “Stand upright on your feet.” And he jumped up and walked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowds saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in Lycaonian, “The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul they called Hermes, because he was the main speaker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest of Zeus, who was in front of the city, brought bulls and garlands to the gates to offer sacrifices with the crowds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard this, they tore their clothes and rushed out into the crowd, crying out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men, why are you doing this? We also are men, of like nature with you, preaching to you to turn from these vain things to the living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea, and everything that is in them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who in times past allowed all nations to walk in their own ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet He did not leave Himself without witness, for He did good and gave us rain from heaven and fruitful seasons, satisfying our hearts with food and gladness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With these words they scarcely restrained the crowds from sacrificing to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some Jews from Antioch and Iconium came there and persuaded the crowds. They stoned Paul and dragged him out of the city, supposing he was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as the disciples gathered around him, he rose up and went into the city. The next day he departed with Barnabas for Derbe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had preached the gospel to that city and had made many disciples, they returned to Lystra and to Iconium and to Antioch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: strengthening the minds of the disciples and exhorting them to continue in the faith, to go through many afflictions and thus enter the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
